issue.title: NPE for private field when triggering fallbackMethod from the Spring @Retry annotation

comment.body:
I was updating the library and found the issue is also happening when using the annotation `@CircuitBreaker` with `fallbackMethod`. It is using the proxy class and the instance objects are null causing `NullPointerException`.

E.g: `@CircuitBreaker(name = "name", fallbackMethod = "fallbackMethod")`

issue.title: Logger inside event handler in circuit breaker printing multiple times

comment.body:
Facing the same problem using spring-cloud-starter-circuitbreaker-resilience4j for state transition event consumer.

`Customizer#once` solved the issue. See https://github.com/spring-cloud/spring-cloud-circuitbreaker/issues/67#issuecomment-623334998

forkee.name: resilience4j
forkee.description: Resilience4j is a fault tolerance library designed for Java8 and functional programming

issue.title: java.lang.StackOverflowError due to infinite loop in CircuitBreakerStateMachine$OpenState.tryAcquirePermission
issue.body: Resilience4j version: 2.1.0 Java version: any I've encountered java.lang.StackOverflowError due to infinite loop in CircuitBreakerStateMachine$OpenState.tryAcquirePermission in a production server, which was under strain. After reviewing the code, I suggest it's caused by failure in the AtomicReference getAndUpdate call (CircuitBreakerStateMachine.java:333), as such failures can occurr due to contention among threads, according to Javadoc. As an aside, Javadoc also states that the updateFunction should be side-effect free, which is not the case here. Once the updateFunction fails during an attempted transition from open to half open state, the AtomicReference CircuitBreakerStateMachine.stateReference still refers to an OpenState whose AtomicBoolean OpenState.isOpen has already been set to false (CircuitBreakerStateMachine.java:812), so the transitionToHalfOpenState() call will not be attempted again, additionally retryAfterWaitDuration is already in the past for this OpenState object. The effect is that OpenState.tryAcquirePermission calls itself recursively (CircuitBreakerStateMachine.java:737) until the StackOverflowError occurs. Please see the attached screenshot displaying a partial stack trace of the StackOverflowError, which was generated under Resilience4j v1.7.1, but the relevant code sections have not changed since then.

issue.title: Removing stale retry configurations from configuration map
issue.body:
Resilience4j version:  resilience4j-retry 2.1.0

Java version: 8

The AbstractRegistry/InMemoryRegistry does not expose a method to remove entries from the configurations map, but it does allow removing Retry objects from entryMap. 
The users of my framework are not processes that run until the JVM's lifetime, so I want a mechanism to clear the configurations when the particular process/application expires. 
Is there a way to do this?

issue.title: Added param recordResultPredicate to CircuitBreaker configurations properties
issue.body:
As we discussed in https://github.com/resilience4j/resilience4j/issues/1955, it is currently not possible to add a predicate result in the application environment variable configuration files. With this PR, it will be possible to customize it using YAML/properties.

![image](https://github.com/resilience4j/resilience4j/assets/66184422/268cf286-5a5b-488c-abde-3a1cd3ffc34a)

comment.body:
@RobWin and @jpdev01 , I'm pretty sure this broke some stuff. Logged https://github.com/resilience4j/resilience4j/issues/2036

When keeping the same spring version 3.1.5 and reverting to 2.0.2, everything works fine again.

issue.title: Exception Thrown creating CircuitBreakerRegistry default bean in version 2.1.0
issue.body:
Resilience4j version: 2.1.0

Java version: 11

Thanks for raising a Resilience4j issue.

Hey team, when bumping Resilience4j up to 2.1.0 from 2.0.2, and Spring from 3.0.3 to 3.1.5, I'm seeing a weird exception - Resilience4j can no longer create the CircuitBreakerRegistry default bean. This exception occurs when trying to create it:

```
Factory method 'circuitBreakerRegistry' threw exception with message: 'java.util.Optional io.github.resilience4j.core.predicate.PredicateCreator.createExceptionsPredicate(java.util.function.Predicate, java.lang.Class[])'
```

Here is my application.yaml configuration:
```
resilience4j:
  circuitbreaker:
    metrics:
      enabled: true
    configs:
      default:
        registerHealthIndicator: true
        slidingWindowType: COUNT_BASED
        slidingWindowSize: 40
        waitDurationInOpenState: 10s
        minimumNumberOfCalls: 30
        slowCallDurationThreshold: 10000
        failureRateThreshold: 80
    instances:
      mmpServiceCB:
        baseConfig: default
      famServiceCB:
        baseConfig: default
      ecsServiceCB:
        baseConfig: default
```

I've search all over online, and checked the issues list, and haven't been able to find anything out.

Thanks for any help!

comment.body:
(FYI) On `AsyncContextImpl`, `consumeResultBeforeRetryAttempt` is only invoked when `attempt >= maxAttempts` and it seems bug!

On `ContextImplt`,  `consumeResultBeforeRetryAttempt ` is invoked on each retry well.

pull_request.title: Fix bug in Retry AsyncContext's onResult consumeResultBaeforeRetryAttempt
pull_request.body: Fix bug in Retry AsyncContext's onResult consumeResultBaeforeRetryAttempt.
